extensionDescription.message: Provides fast access to millions of open and subscription research papers and books - using your institution subscriptions.

previouslyAccessedItemsEmpty.message: Oops, no items here... :( Start browsing on a supported discovery service.

onboardingMessage.message: Please follow these simple steps to add GetFTR links to all websites

institutionDescription.message: GetFTR buttons will be added to content that your institution subscribes to, and content that is open or freely available.

institutionContinueNoInstitutionsSubtitl.message: Don't worry if your institution isn't in the list. You can still access open and free content and subscription content when on campus.

discoveryWebsitesDescription.message: GetFTR buttons will be added to all discovery websites that you have enabled

grantPermissionsDescription.message: The extension needs your permission to access the websites you visit, so it can display GetFTR buttons for you

grantPermissionsMessage.message: Please click the button below, then grant the permission to access the websites you visit in the browser popup

grantPermissionsAlert.message: The extension needs your permission to access the websites you visit, so it can display GetFTR buttons for you. Please click the button below, then grant the permission in the browser popup!

noInstitutionsEnabled.message: You haven't selected your institutions yet. You can set them up on the Institutions tab to get access to their subscriptions.

pinDescription.message: Pin the extension to your toolbar to quickly access recently viewed content or to update your institution(s).

onboardingCompleteDescription.message: You're all set! Look out for GetFTR buttons on websites to get instant access to content:

tryOutDescription.message: You can try some of the supported discovery websites using the following links:

exampleDescription.message: Click on the GetFTR buttons displayed in search results and article pages to access the content you need.

exampleButton.message: Example of GetFTR buttons indicating user is entitled to full text and document has been retracted
